Job Title: Lead Azure Cloud Engineer

Location: McLean, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

Department Summary:

The External Cloud Team in ECIS is seeking a Lead Azure Cloud Engineer to support the development and administration of MITRE's enterprise cloud environment in Azure. As a member of our team, you’ll build and apply hands-on expertise across the full Azure ecosystem. It's our goal to establish and maintain the technical foundation upon which projects can work securely in the cloud, empowering users to be self-sufficient and agile while minimizing risk to MITRE and remaining in compliance with InfoSec policy.

Job Description:

Define and lead development of a robust governance framework for securing Azure environments in accordance with prevailing policy.Guide the security, networking, governance, and automation of MITRE’s Azure architecture.Provide technical leadership and mentorship.Troubleshoot complex technical issues and provide advanced operational support to internal MITRE customers in Azure.Work closely with InfoSec to define secure baselines in AzureCollaborate with other MITRE teams in pursuit of cross-domain, multi-cloud, and hybrid solutions involving AzureShare knowledge across MITRE and with external partners

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree with eight years’ related experience, or a master’s degree with six years’ related experience, preferably with a technical major such as engineering, computer science, etc.Demonstrated expertise in Azure cloud technologies and service offeringsExperience with cloud networking skills required to deploy secure cloud environments.History of performing hands-on work to solve complex technical problems.Self-motivated, curious, and collaborative, with a passion to learn new technologies and develop new skills.Ability to obtain a DoD Secret clearance within one year of being hired

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience securing systems to one or more compliance standards (e.g., NIST 800-171, NIST 800-53)Experience using cloud automation tools, such as Terraform, etc.Experience with DevOps and CI/CD automated build and deploy processes using tools such as GitLab, etc.Excellent written and oral communication skills, to include ability to effectively develop technical support documentationActive DoD Secret clearance

This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s):

Secret

This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s):

Secret

Work Location Type:

Hybrid
